summaryText: What a powerful message about the power of praise from Pastor Darrison Tellez! In this electrifying sermon, he challenges us to understand that our breath is not just about survival, but about releasing powerful praise. Pastor Darrison takes us on a journey through the biblical significance of praise, reminding us that praise is more than just an activity - it's a weapon that can break strongholds and transform our circumstances. Drawing from David's example in the Psalms, he reveals that praise isn't dependent on our situation, but is a choice we make regardless of what we're facing. Can you imagine praising God even when everything looks dead? That's the kind of radical faith Pastor Darrison is calling us to! He shares a hilarious personal story about his daughter to illustrate how we can become 'tolerant' of toxic things if we're not careful, but then pivots to show how praise can be our breakthrough. The most powerful moment? When he declares that you have 'a lion in your lungs' - meaning the Holy Spirit's power is within you to praise through any challenge. Whether you're in a prison like Paul and Silas or facing your own personal battles, praise can shake open doors and break chains. This sermon isn't just a message - it's a call to warfare through worship!
mainPoints: Praise is more for you than for God
Praise matters in how, when, where, and who you praise
Praise is a spiritual weapon that breaks strongholds
Praise is a state of being, not just an activity

versesMentioned.text: And God said, 'Let there be light,' and there was light.
Then the Lord God formed a man from the dust of the ground and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life, and the man became a living being.
I will praise the Lord at all times; his praise will always be on my lips.
Through Jesus, therefore, let us continually offer to God a sacrifice of praise—the fruit of lips that openly profess his name.
I tell you, if they keep quiet, the stones will cry out.
Then one of the elders said to me, 'Do not weep! See, the Lion of the tribe of Judah, the Root of David, has triumphed. He is able to open the scroll and its seven seals.'
Let the redeemed of the Lord tell their story— those he redeemed from the hand of the foe.
Praise the Lord. Praise God in his sanctuary; praise him in his mighty heavens. Praise him for his acts of power; praise him for his surpassing greatness.

Monday.scripture: Psalm 150:6: 'Let everything that has breath praise the Lord. Praise the Lord!'
Monday.focus: Recognizing the power of breath and praise
Monday.action: Take intentional moments throughout the day to pause and offer praise, even in challenging situations. Write down three things you're grateful for, regardless of your current circumstances.
Monday.prayer: Lord, teach me to praise You in all seasons. Help me recognize that my breath is a gift and an opportunity to glorify You. Give me a heart of thanksgiving that transcends my current situation. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Psalm 34:1: 'I will extol the Lord at all times; his praise will always be on my lips.'
Tuesday.focus: Developing a lifestyle of continuous praise
Tuesday.action: Set reminders on your phone to praise God at unexpected moments. When a challenge arises, immediately respond with a praise statement.
Tuesday.prayer: Father, help me transform my thinking from complaining to praising. Let my first response to challenges be worship. Fill my mouth with Your praise. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Acts 16:25-26: 'About midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God, and the other prisoners were listening to them. Suddenly there was such a violent earthquake that the foundations of the prison were shaken.'
Wednesday.focus: Understanding praise as a spiritual weapon
Wednesday.action: Create a 'praise playlist' of worship songs. Listen to it during a challenging time and actively worship instead of worrying.
Wednesday.prayer: God, teach me to see praise as a powerful spiritual weapon. When I feel surrounded by darkness, help me lift my voice in worship. Break through my circumstances with Your power. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: 2 Chronicles 20:22: 'As they began to sing and praise, the Lord set ambushes against the men of Ammon and Moab and Mount Seir who were invading Judah, and they were defeated.'
Thursday.action: Identify an area of struggle in your life. Spend time praising God specifically in that area, declaring His goodness despite current circumstances.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, I choose to praise You even when I cannot see the breakthrough. Let my praise be a weapon that shifts atmospheres and releases Your power. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Philippians 4:4: 'Rejoice in the Lord always. I will say it again: Rejoice!'
Friday.focus: Making praise a consistent state of being
Friday.action: Challenge yourself to respond to every negative thought with a praise statement. Keep a 'praise journal' to track how this transforms your perspective.
Friday.prayer: Father, help me cultivate a heart of continuous praise. Transform my mind from a complaining spirit to a thankful spirit. Let my life be a living worship. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Psalm 103:1: 'Praise the Lord, my soul; all my inmost being, praise his holy name.'
Saturday.action: Spend extended time in worship - through music, journaling, or quiet reflection. Ask God to reveal areas where you need to release praise.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, search my heart. Reveal any areas of bitterness, fear, or doubt. Fill me with Your spirit of praise. Let my entire being - body, soul, and spirit - worship You. Amen.
